turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Motionhouse.
turn.2: "Scattered" continues to tour into 2012 and beyond and completed its first international tour in 2011, taking in dates in Macau, Belgium and Portugal as well as a return visit to Romania.
turn.4: Tours of "Scattered" are planned for the China in autumn 2012 and Motionhouse has also been taken on by IMGA Artists who are currently representing the company in USA, Asia/Pacific and Europe and are building a tour of "Scattered" planned for the United States in spring 2013.
turn.5: What other pieces did they perform?
turn.6: Motionhouse have 3 festival pieces in rep, Cascade, Underground and Chaser which are widely performed across the UK and Europe.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: Generally, these pieces require fewer dancers than the theatre touring pieces, are smaller and therefore more flexible and easier to tour and are usually shorter (lasting from fifteen to twenty five minutes).
turn.10: As a result, the company can perform at simultaneous festivals in different locations, performing more than once a day.
turn.12: Motionhouse’s 2008 piece Underground won the Audience Prize at the MiramirO Festival in Ghent, Belgium in 2009.
